org.webchecker.forms

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.webchecker.forms.Input
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckboxInput, RadioInput

    public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    HTML form input element. Only considers name, value and type attributes of HTML input element.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jindřich Máca (Tuník), Matěj Kripner<kripnermatej@gmail.com>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Input(java.lang.String name, Type type)
      Constructor that leaves the input value set to null, that means, this input won't be Form.send().
      Input(java.lang.String name, Type type, java.lang.String value)
      Constructor that sets all Input attributes and by this, makes it ready to be Form.send().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Getter for the input name.

      Getter for the input type.

      Getter for the input value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Input

        public Input(@NotNull
             java.lang.String name,
             @NotNull
             Type type)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor that leaves the input value set to null, that means, this input won't be Form.send().

        Other then known Types of Input should not be constructed, so parameter type can not be null. Parameter name can not be empty or null, because Form doesn't create such Inputs. If the given parameters do not correspond with this rules, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        name - String name of the Input
        type - Type of the Input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or both of given parameters are null, or the name parameter is empty

      • Input

        public Input(java.lang.String name,
             Type type,
             java.lang.String value)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor that sets all Input attributes and by this, makes it ready to be Form.send().

        Other then known Types of Input should not be constructed, so parameter input type can not be null. Input name can not be empty or null. If input value is null, this input won't be Form.send().

        Parameters:
        name - String name of the Input
        type - Type of the Input
        value - String value of the Input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name or type parameter is null, or the name parameter is empty

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for the input name.
        Returns:
        String value of the input name

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Getter for the input value.
        Returns:
        String value of the input value

      • getType

        public Type getType()
        Getter for the input type.
        Returns:
        Type of the input type

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
        Setter for the input value. If you set parameter value to null, this Input won't be Form.send().
        Parameters:
        value - String value to be set to the input value

      • isFilled

        public java.lang.Boolean isFilled()
        Checks if the Input is filled. Not filled Input won't be Form.send().
        Returns:
        true if Input is filled, otherwise false
